FDG.function_description: Manage or create notes in an app

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Notes page (entry page 0). The core action is clicking the 'More options' icon (three vertical dots) at the top right. Since there's only one action here, the flow is a single step with no branches or loops yet, as the provided action is the only one for this functional point's current scope.

steps.summary: Click the 'More options' icon (three vertical dots) at the top right of the Notes page.

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a side menu (drawer) in the Omni Notes FOSS app, providing navigation options to access the main notes page or the app's settings.

FDG.function_description: This page functions as the main notes overview screen, showing an empty state (with "Nothing here!") and providing options to search notes (via the search icon), sort notes, and create a new note (via the red plus button), while also allowing navigation through the menu.

The core logic involves interacting with the search icon: clicking it (action S1) likely triggers a search functionality, with the flow remaining on the same page (no new page navigation here). There are no branches or loops in this single-action flow yet, but the screen also offers options to sort notes or create a new note (via the red plus button) and navigate via the menu, which could be future actions.

steps.summary: Click the search icon

FDG.function_description: The current page (a voice input dialog from Google) allows the user to attempt voice - based input (likely for searching notes) again by tapping the microphone icon, after a previous attempt, within the note - management app's search functionality context.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the notes page (page 0). They click the sort icon (action at S1), which leads to a new page (page 2). The flow is a straight line as there are no branches or loops here.

steps.summary: Click the sort icon

FDG.function_description: The page appears to be displaying information related to leaks in the "it.feio.android.omninotes.foss" application, likely for diagnostic or debugging purposes to identify and analyze memory or resource leaks within the Omni Notes app.

Click close menu button to return to page 0

FDG.function_description: The Settings page in Omni Notes FOSS allows users to configure various app options including preferences, data, interface, navigation, behaviors, notifications, privacy, beta program participation, access help resources, and view app information like changelog.

This action navigates to the Settings page (page 4), where various app configuration options (preferences, data, interface, etc.) and help/about resources are accessible. No branches or loops are present in this initial flow as it's a direct navigation to the Settings page.

FDG.function_description: This page functions as a text note creation interface where users can input a title, content, and optionally add a reminder for a new note.

After that, the user can click the content input field to start entering the note's content. There are no branches or loops in this initial flow as it focuses on accessing the input fields for note creation.

Click the content input field to prepare for entering the note content

FDG.function_description: The Interface settings page in Omni Notes FOSS allows users to configure various interface - related preferences, including language, text size, application color scheme, and toggle options for features like the floating action button, simple calendar and time interface, attachments position, and date display format.

updated application color scheme setting (Notes list only)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Interface option on the Settings page. Then, it proceeds to click the Application color scheme (Strip only) option on the Interface page. At this point, a branch point appears where the user can choose one of four radio options (Disabled, Strip only, Notes list only, Complete) or click CANCEL to return to the Interface page. The main flow involves navigating to the color scheme selection and then choosing a specific scheme or canceling.

steps.summary: Click Interface option on Settings page
Click Application color scheme (Strip only) on Interface page
Click Disabled radio option
Click Strip only radio option
Click Notes list only radio option
Click Complete radio option
Click CANCEL button

steps.summary: Click Behaviors option in Settings
Click Checklists option in Behaviors
Select Keep position radio

Click CANCEL button to return to Behaviors

FDG.function_description: The Notifications page in Omni Notes FOSS allows users to configure notification - related settings such as enabling vibration, selecting a ringtone, setting the second reminder delay, and enabling notifications persistence.

Click OK button to confirm changes and return to Notifications page
